item.title: Quote: Characterization tests
item.description: In Working effectively with legacy code, Michael Feathers talks a type of tests to define or characterize the current behavior of the legacy system: In nearly every legacy system, what the system does is more important than what it is supposed to do. A characterization test is a test that characterizes the actual behavior of a piece of code. […] The test document the actual current behavior of the system.
